intro: Nototriche famatinensis, commonly known as the Famatinian nototriche, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Argentina. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
